How to Install qtqr on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • qtqr

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install qtqr on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing qtqr on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall qtqr in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install qtqr, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install qtqr Using apt

To install qtqr in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install qtqr using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install qtqr

The installation of qtqr might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install qtqr Using apt-get

To install qtqr using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install qtqr.

sudo apt-get -y install qtqr

Install qtqr Using Synaptic

To install qtqr using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install qtqr on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for qtqr. This will display the qtqr package in the package window, now to install qtqr, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the qtqr package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of qtqr.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install qtqr Using aptitude

To install qtqr on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of qtqr.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install qtqr using the command aptitude install qtqr.

sudo aptitude -y install qtqr

How to Upgrade qtqr on debian

If you want to upgrade the qtqr package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade qtqr using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade qtqr to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade qtqr.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade qtqr sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade qtqr

Upgrade qtqr using Aptitude

To upgrade qtqr using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade qtqr.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade qtqr

Upgrade qtqr using Synaptic

To upgrade qtqr using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for qtqr, now right-click qtqr, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade qtqr just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall qtqr on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall qtqr from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just qtqr, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove qtqr

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of qtqr

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of qtqr you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge qtqr

Remove qtqr using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall qtqr using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for qtqr, right-click the qtqr package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall qtqr click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install qtqr on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade qtqr using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of qtqr then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
